content:
Had a very bad time solving this in shortest mode.

Turns out every single input test had a new line at the end and I wasn't removing it (shortest mode). So I was adding the brain---- for '\n' to the end of my answers. :(((

This is not fun for debugging, because the in-game "Found/Expected" prompts truncate the output and answer with "..." so you can't actually fix bugs like this easily in a timed situation. I got 0% (63 char). Added ".chomp" to my code (69 char) and it works perfectly in IDE.

I have now removed all the annoying newlines from the tests/validators. It's a shortest mode catastrophe, especially for a brainf*ck clash.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: the concept is really fun and simple
it's fun, and not to difficult, i like it

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Clear and simple enough to do in both mode

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple enough to be fun to do in the shortest mode. The need to read it carefully before doing it is interesting for the fastest mode.

I coded a solution in a few minutes and all the tests cases are correct and relevant.
